choices.A: Configure mode esrst under voice register global configuration mode.
choices.C: Configure mode esrst under voice service voip configuration mode.
choices.B: Configure mode srst under telephony-service configuration mode.
choices.D: Configure mode esrst under telephony-service configuration mode.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I have configured SRST/ESRST for years now. The answer is A. SIP uses the Voice Register Global and ESRST is the default operating mode. Telephony-Service is for SCCP ONLY. Voice Service Voip is for setting Global Voice Configuration/Operation and is not used purely for ESRST/SRST

From URL:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/general/xmart/test-page/sccp_and_sip_srst_admin_guide/enhanced_srst.pdf
When you configure Unified E-SRST, it provides the following feature benefits in comparison to the classic Cisco Unified SRST:
• Voice Hunt Group
• Shared Lines
• Mixed Shared Lines (SIP and SCCP Phones)
• Hunt Statistics Collection
• Mixed Deployment (SIP and SCCP Phones)
• Shared Line
• BLF
• Video
• B-ACD

comments.content: To clarify further, since the question mentions SIP phones you would configure eSRST under Voice Register Global. For SCCP you would configure under telephony-service. Devil is in the details.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A

A. Configure mode esrst under voice register global configuration mode.
esrst is configured under voice register global and is required to support B-ACD

B. Configure mode srst under telephony-service configuration mode.
SRST does not support B-ACD and is not configured under telephony-service

C. Configure mode esrst under voice service voip configuration mode.
is not configured under voice service voip (border-element is, but not srst/esrst)

D. Configure mode esrst under telephony-service configuration mode.
esrst is not configured under telephony-service

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/general/xmart/test-page/sccp_and_sip_srst_admin_guide/enhanced_srst.pdf

questions.question_text: An engineer is implementing survivability for a collaboration environment. The environment is utilizing a centralized Cisco UCM at the headquarters and Cisco IOS-XE gateways in the remote branches. Which action must the engineer take to enable both shared lines and B-ACD for SIP branch phones during a WAN outage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
Process of elimination would make me choose C

A. Run RTMP on the Cisco router.
MGCP and RTMP have nothing to do with one another

B. Verify that the MGCP service is running under serviceability in Cisco UCM.
This service doesn't exist. Pretty sure MGCP is handled by the CallManager Service

C. Run the debug mgcp media command on the Cisco router.
This is a valid command and could be useful in seeing the media on the router

D. Run the debug H.323 gateway command on the Cisco router.
This would make no sense as we are dealing with MGCP, not H323

choices.A: Run RTMP on the Cisco router.
choices.B: Verify that the MGCP service is running under serviceability in Cisco UCM.
choices.C: Run the debug mgcp media command on the Cisco router.
choices.D: Run the debug H.323 gateway command on the Cisco router.

questions.question_text: Users report silence on the line when they try to connect to external voice numbers. The company is using Cisco 8865 phones with Cisco UCM connected to a gateway with two T1 circuits. The MGCP server seems to be responding. Which action must the engineer take to begin to investigate the media for this type of issue?
What is a function of the metadata carried in SIP sessions between the recording client and the recording server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the answer. Meta Data is Identity based information

Metadata has the following functions:

Carry the communication session data (audio and video calls) that describes the call to the recording server.

Identifies the participants list.

Identifies the session and media association time.

If there are any changes in the call sessions, for example, hold-resume, transfer and so on, these sessions are notified to the recording server through metadata.

Selected Answer: D
I believe D is correct. Typically metadata contains information about the call, such as participants.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/voice/cube/configuration/cube-book/voi-sip-recording.html

choices.B: It provides advanced capabilities, such as speech analytics.
choices.D: It identifies the participant change due to transfers during the call.
choices.A: It forks RTP media to the recorder.
choices.C: It sets up a new SIP session

questions.question_text:
Some users report poor quality when they travel to another continent and make calls. This issue applies only to one continent and not to others, where typically the dialing is fast and quality is clear. Users experience the same result at home when they call the same numbers in that specific continent. It seems like some users do not exist in the correct PSTN gateway when making calls to a specific country. The company is using TEHO to save on the cost of international or long-distance calling.

They are also using a globalized dial plan. What is the cause of the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Yeah. I think your first instincts were right. I vote A.

Selected Answer: C
Changed my mind, it is saying when they travel to ... (Mobility) - Device pool, hence gateway in the device pool

Selected Answer: A
A, D is not right since it talks about fast dialing and even home users, TEHO is not working

Selected Answer: D
I'm going with D on this one

choices.B: A local route group is not added to the route pattern.
choices.C: The users are missing this specific gateway at the device pool level.
choices.A: CUBE is not configured for TEHO in the specific country.
choices.D: Regions in Cisco UCM are not configured correctly.

questions.question_text: An administrator is configuring Meet-me conferencing in a Cisco UCM deployment and has created the Meet-me number and ensured that it is in a partition accessible by all devices. Which two additional steps must the administrator perform? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
A and E are correct

choices.A: Ensure that conferencing-initiating devices are using a media resource group list that contains at least one Cisco UCM conference bridge.
choices.D: Ensure that all devices have G.729 enabled.
choices.C: Enable Meet-me conferencing in enterprise parameters.
choices.B: Disable Early Media on the SIP profile of all devices that will use Meet-me conferencing.
choices.E: Update the softkey template on all phones to ensure that they contain the Meet-me softkey.
